籤詩版本二:
Qin Jun Nai’s conservative life
Be careful not to do anything bad
Wait until someone gently applies force
Dead old tree regenerated flowers
詩意: This hexagram is like dead wood growing flowers. Everything has its own success.
解曰: Be conservative and quiet. Things come true. If it moves, there will be many disasters. There is no blame in silence.
籤詩故事一:
◇Weishui fishing
In the Zhou Dynasty, Jiang Shang, named Ziya, was born in Ji (a native of Xuzhou, East China Sea), and his Taoist name was Fei Xiong. The ancestor was granted the title of Zai Lu (place name), so he was also called Lu Wang.
In order to escape the troubled times of King Zhou of Shang Dynasty, Jiang Ziya lived by the water of the East China Sea and fished in the Weishui River.
The fishhook is straight. In fact, his heart is not fishing, but his ambition is to be the prime minister.
King Wen heard that he was wise and hired him as his teacher (prime minister). (Jiang Ziya was eighty years old at the time)
Later, King Wu of Zhou attacked King Zhou of Shang, destroyed the Shang Dynasty, and established the Zhou Dynasty. King Wu called Jiang Ziya Shangfu. Feng Jiang's son, Ding Gong, became the Marquis of Qi.
(This story is a metaphor: wait for the opportunity, wait until there is a triggering opportunity, then development will begin.)
聖意:
The house is safe.
Good luck to itself.
Ask for money and wait for the time.
Transaction completed.
Marriage Just.
Liujia gave birth to a girl.
Pedestrians block.
Tiancan: Five points.


Six animals are difficult.
Looking for people.
Good luck in the lawsuit.
Migration. Conservatism.
Lost items are empty.
Disease and blessing.
Mountain tomb is auspicious.
